ECEntityClass.description: A pump which impels fluid by reaction forces from moving (rotating) vanes or blades inside a pump casing.

Centrifugal Utility is less about the centrifugal (or axial) quality of the design than it is about the purpose and geometry (utility) of it. Most fans are either centrifugal or axial, its really the utility part that defines the use. Whereas an exhaust fan simply pulls air from a space, a utility fan takes incoming air from the space or outside and mechanically increases the velocity and/or the pressure of the outgoing air.

ECEntityClass.description: control valve with electric motor actuator

A electronic circuit that is a communication device that multiplexes (combines) several signals for transmission over a single medium. A demultiplexor completes the process by separating multiplexed signals from a transmission line. Frequently a multiplexor and demultiplexor are combined into a signal device capable of processing both outgoing and incoming signals.

ECProperty.description: Alternative Tag Number
the weight of a body in a specific reference system is the force which, when applied to the body, would give it an acceleration equal to free fall in that reference system
A set point that is the limit for activation of the low alarm.
A set point that is the limit for activation of the high alarm

ECEntityClass.description: A needle valve that is equipped with an actuator that manipulates a stream of fluid in the response to a signal from an external sensing element and with input of energy from an external source.

a globe valve that has a closure member with the shape of a conical plug (needle) which closes into a small seat. typically used for flow metering or damping of pressure fluctuations on instruments, e.g. pressure gauge.

a membrane valve that is comprising a flexible tube, either exposed or enclosed in a body. the tube is pinched to close by mechanical means.

an artefact intended for plugging a piping end.

ECEntityClass.description: A physical object that is intended to transfer heat from one object to another.

A control valve that is a plug valve with corresponding actuator intended to manipulate a stream of fluid in the response to a difference between a signal from an external sensing element and a set point and with input of energy from an external source.
a valve that is a valve where the closure member has a rotating action. the axis of rotation is usually normal to the flow.
a rotary valve that has a quarter turn action in which the closure member is a cylindrical or tapered plug which operates by rotating on its axis and sealing against a downstream seat.
A compressor intended to compress and transport gas according to the reciprocating or rotary displacement principle.

ECProperty.description: a displacement that is the volumetric amount a positive displacement pump is delivering per one revolution of the pump shaft.

ECEntityClass.description: a gauge intended to measure and display a representation of a measured pressure

ECProperty.description: an operating temperature that is the highest temperature under which an object is expected to operate.
an operating temperature that is the lowest temperature under which an object is expected to operate.

ECEntityClass.description: a self acting control valve that is maintaining a predefined upstream or downstream fluid flow operated by the process pressure.

ECProperty.description: Reduced Pressure

ECEntityClass.description: a self actuated pressure control valve that is equipped with an internal pressure sensing element that reduces the upstream line pressure to a set level downstream, and maintains the reduced pressure irrespective of changes in upstream pressure.
a regulator that is regulating the pressure in system.
a self operating valve that is set to open at a certain pressure level to prevent the pressure in a container or system from reaching unsafe levels.
a relief valve that is an automatic pressure relieving device actuated by the static pressure upstream of the valve.

ECProperty.description: a percentage of the set pressure which can be allowed without damage.

ECEntityClass.description: a switch which is turned on and off by the variation of a pressure level.
A transmitter mesuring pressure and generating a standardized output signal representing the measured pressure
An Process Connection Between different drawings
A controller intended to contain and execute control logic software

A pressure vessel located in both pump- and compressor piping systems in order to reduce residual pulsation fluctuations, as a result of discontinue operation effects, within an allowable level specified.
A boiler that is intended to partially vaporise liquid.
A positive displacement compressor in which forced reduction of gas volume takes place by the movement of a displacing element in a cylinder or enclosure.

ECEntityClass.description: a piping flange where the nominal bore size of the non-flanged end is smaller than the nominal bore size of the flanged end.
a piping tee where the nominal diameters of the ends are not all the same.

Ventilation fan used to extract air from a space.This is a type of roof exhaust fan (roof mounted) that is designed to throw air high and away from a building to prevent re-entry of exhaust air. The velocity of throw from the fan eliminates the need for a duct stack attached to the fan above the roof level.

ECProperty.description: Connection Width

ECEntityClass.description: A rotary valve that is equipped with an actuator that manipulates a stream of fluid in the response to a signal from an external sensing element and with input of energy from an external source.
an artefact designed to burst at a certain excess pressure forming part of a rupture disc assembly.

ECProperty.description: a back pressure which is the back pressure an instrument is allowed to have under stated conditions.
an area of a rupturing disc as designated by the supplier or manufacturer.
a pressure which is the pressure that causes something to burst.

ECEntityClass.description: A distillation column intended to clean gas by washing the gas flow with water or with another liquid entering at the top of the vessel and sprayed in the gas. Typically to remove dust and small particles.

ECProperty.description: Mass of matter which crosses a given surface divided by time.
A flow rate which is the volume of matter that crosses a given surface divided by time.
Vapour, liquid, slurry, ect
The degree or intensity of heat or cold as measured on a thermometric scale, and a measure of whether two systems are relatively hot or cold with respect to one another.

force perpendicular to the area divided by area. p = df/da where df is the perpendicular component of the force acting on the area element da. the pressure is positive when the force is acting into the area.
Mass divided by volume.
Dynamic Viscosity. tau xz=eta (delta(vx)/delta(z)) where tau xz is the shear stress in a fluid moving with a viscosity gradient dvx/dz perpendicular to the plane of shear.

ECEntityClass.description: A mill which are used in earlier stages of comminution of hard rock. Typically works on dry feed as it falls between advancing and receding braking plates.
A crusher which is a heavy-duty rock-breaking machine with fixed vertical, and inclined swing jaw, between which large lumps of ore are crushed.
control valve with solenoid actuator
a device which is intended to provide a certain distance between two parts within an assembly.

ECProperty.description: A straight linear distance that is a distance between two center points
intercept made by the circumference on a straight line through the centre of a circle.

ECEntityClass.description: an artefact consisting of two disc with equal thickness and outer diameter connected with a flat bar. one of the discs is furnished with a hole thus allowing fluid flow, and the other blocing the flow. the first is installed during normal operation, the latter when blocking is required.
spectical blind normally closed

ECProperty.description: a thickness which is the thickness of the part of an object normally called wall: - wall thickness of a pipe, - thickness of a building wall, etc.

ECEntityClass.description: A recepatacle, container or part of a structure designed and manufactured to keep solids or liquids.
A recepatacle, container or part of a structure designed and manufactured to keep solids or liquids.
A trap that consists of a chamber into which condensed steam from steam pipes etc. is allowed to drain, and which automatically ejects it withoutpermitting the escape of steam
A stop check valve that is equipped with an actuator that manipulates a stream of fluid in the response to a signal from an external sensing element and with input of energy from an external source.
a lift check valve that is combining the self-acting operation of a check valve with the manual action of a globe valve.
a stop cock valve
cylindrical storage unit with variety of roofs and foundations
A condenser that contains vertical plates to separate condensate from a vapour flow.
A functional object which is an assembly of functional units forming a network to provide a type of service or serving a common purpose. The functional units does not have to be physically connected.

ECEntityClass.description: A physical object that is intended to transfer heat from one object to another.
A controller that receives a signal from a thermocouple or RDT, compares the actual temperature to the setpoint and provides an output to the control system.
A gauge intended to measure and indicate a temperature
an indicator intended to give a visual indication of a temperature.
a regulator intnded to control a temperature using the expansion of a substance
A switch that is intended to give a on/off signal when the temperature have reached a preset value.
A transmitter measuring and generating a standardized output signal representing the measured temperature
A part of a component which provides a re-usable connection.

ECProperty.description: measured as positive upwards. it is either the distance above the earth' surface or above a reference plane subparallel to the earth' surface.
a weight which is a sum of the weights of identified parts of an assembly.
a weight of an object excluding any operating or process fluids.

a multi way valve that is made with three separate paths of flow.
a ball valve that is a three way valve with three paths of flow through the valve body.

ECProperty.description: a weight which is the weight of a content.

a plug valve that is a three way valve with three paths of flow through the valve body.
To connect two sections of a pipeline.
A recepatacle, container or part of a structure designed and manufactured to keep solids or liquids.

ECProperty.description: a pressure which an object is designed to withstand.
a temperature which an object is designed to withstand.

ECEntityClass.description: The tray limited by a Node and a Break, Node and Connector, two Nodes, two Breaks, two Connectors or a Break and a Connector. The last five providing there are no Breaks or Connectors in between. In the last three cases the Segment will coincide with a Tray Branch.

ECEntityClass.description: A self acting control valve that automatically releases excess pressure or admits pressure to prevent a vacuum.
A detector in which ocillating motion is transfered into a voltage or current signal.
a wafer pattern valve that is a check valve with a wafer pattern valve body.
A boiler that creates thermal energy by burning material.
an indicator intended to give a visual indication of measured weight
a switch intended to give a on/off signal when the measured weight have reached a preset value
A transmitter which output is proportional to a measured weight.
A valve that has in-line ports and stem emerging at an angle of approx 45 degrees.
